div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, May 12, 1897. MUSICAL AND LITERARY NIGHT STAGED BY YOUNG MEN'S ARCHBROTHERHOOD

body.p: A musical and literary program was given by the Young Men's Archbrotherhood Sunday, May 9, at the St. Stanislaus Kostka parish hall. The entertainment was as follows:
3. Declamation, "In Honor of Polish Priests," Valentine Roszkowiak
4. Song, "Hail, Mazurs," St. Stanislaus Kostka Men's Choir
5. Declamation, "It Is Forbidden to Us," Miss F. Jazdziewska
6. Song, "May Dawn," St. Stanislaus Kostka Young Ladies' Choir
9. Declamation, "I Am Proud That I Am a Pole," John Bombera
11. Tribute to the Reverend Joseph Gieburowski

Sincere thanks are expressed to Mr. Chojnacki, director of the lower choir (sic) of St. Stanislaus Kostka's parish, and to the singers. Thanks are also
extended to Miss Frances Jazdziewska for her splendid recitation.
